    • Constructor Detail

      • Bubble

        public Bubble(int x,
              int y)
        Create A Bubble with a specific position. Generates a random start direction. Increases the static counter for bubbles and sets the unique name.
        Parameters:
        x - x-position of the Bubble
        y - y-position of the Bubble

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return the name and the position as a String. Calls the superclass' toString method to get the position as a string. Overriding the default toString method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class OceanObject
        Returns:
        string containing name and position

      • calc

        public void calc(int PPS,
                 long FPS,
                 int oceanWidth,
                 int oceanDepth)
        Sets all parameters for the next step with given speed and FPS. Bubble ignores width of an ocean, so it might go out the screen, but it will reappear again on the oceans ground
        Specified by:
        calc in class OceanObject
        Parameters:
        PPS - speed in pixel per second
        FPS - frame-rate in frames per second
        oceanWidth - width of the ocean
        oceanDepth - depth of the ocean

      • rndDirection

        private int rndDirection()
        Generate a new random direction for a Bubble. (in degree) The return value is an integer from 20 to 159 and should be interpreted as an angle
        Returns:
        random direction for a Bubble

      • calcNextPos

        private float[] calcNextPos(int PPS,
                            long FPS)
        Computes the exact next Position according to Speed and FPS
        Parameters:
        PPS - speed in pixel per frame
        FPS - frame-rate in frames per second
        Returns:
        exact position for next step
